title: application/xml
description: Some method verbs expect the resource to be sent as a request body. For example, to create a resource, the request must include the details of the resource to create. Resources CAN have alternate representations. For example, an API might support both JSON and XML representations. A method's body is defined in the body property as a hashmap, in which the key MUST be a valid media type.

children.title: name
children.description: Type name for top level types. For properties and parameters -- property o parameter name, respectively. For bodies -- media type.

children.title: allowedTargets
children.description: Restrictions on where annotations of this type can be applied. If this property is specified, annotations of this type may only be applied on a property corresponding to one of the target names specified as the value of this property.

children.title: default
children.description: Provides default value for a property

children.title: discriminator
children.description: Type property name to be used as discriminator, or boolean

children.title: discriminatorValue
children.description: The value of discriminator for the type.

children.title: maxProperties
children.description: The maximum number of properties allowed for instances of this type.

children.title: minProperties
children.description: The minimum number of properties allowed for instances of this type.

children.title: additionalProperties
children.description: A Boolean that indicates if an object instance has additional properties.

children.title: displayName
children.description: The displayName attribute specifies the type display name. It is a friendly name used only for  display or documentation purposes. If displayName is not specified, it defaults to the element's key (the name of the property itself).

children.title: description
children.description: A longer, human-friendly description of the type

children.title: type
children.description: A base type which the current type extends, or more generally a type expression.

children.title: Type
children.description: A base type which the current type extends, or more generally a type expression.
